Pre-Game Insights: Both Bosnia and Herzegovina and Hungary aim for their first 2024-25 UEFA Nations League victory in Monday’s clash in Zenica.
Neither side has managed to secure a win in this campaign, and with relegation looming, emotions are running high.
Bosnia have lost eight of their last nine international games, yet their only draw in this period came against Hungary in a 0-0 result just last month.
Hungary also come into this fixture off the back of consecutive draws.
Bosnia’s issues lie predominantly in their defence, conceding seven goals in just three Nations League matches.
Hungary have had their own struggles scoring goals, managing just one other goal in their Nations League campaign.
Bosnia’s defensive woes and Hungary’s attacking inconsistency make a draw the safest bet here.
Both teams know they can’t afford to lose, with Bosnia at risk of relegation and Hungary keen to avoid a similar fate.
